title: Château La Croix de Queynac 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This perfumed wine from the Fronsac's Gabard family is well balanced, with a warmth that is immediately enticing. The spice and ripe lychee flavors give it richness as well as adding complexity. Drink this well-structured, lightly mineral wine now.

title: Château La Rame 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Strong notes of apricot and tropical fruits dominate this Sauvignon Blanc, sourced from a nine-acre vineyard. It has a rich core that is juicy, while the fresher lemon and lime flavors give it an exotic perfumed character. This full, ripe wine is delicious and ready to drink now.

title: Château Mourgues du Grès 2017 Galets Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)
description: Crisp tones of white peach, strawberry and raspberry perfume this vibrant, dry rosé. The palate is juicy and forward, offering loads of tart red currant and red plum flavors, edged with chalk and stone. Drink now.

title: Château Peyrassol 2017 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: From a selection of old vines, this concentrated wine is rich, full of spice, pepper and bold red-fruit flavors. It is intense with both acidity and fruitiness, a tangy wine that finishes with a tight bite of lemon zest. Drink now.

title: Colognole 2014  Chianti Rufina
description: Made from 95% Sangiovese and 5% Colorino, this opens with woodland berry, cinnamon, violet and wild herb aromas. The elegant, savory palate offers strawberry compote, red raspberry, star anise and cinnamon flavors alongside fresh acidity and polished tannins. Drink through 2019.

title: Domaine de la Colline Saint-Jean 2015 Red (Vacqueyras)
description: Crisp black cherry and raspberry tones are accented by whiffs of nuts and smoke in this unctuous, concentrated wine. While approachable and forward in fruit, it has an invigorating mineral backbone and firm, grippy tannins that lend structure and gravitas.

title: Domaine de Ponteveze 2017 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Grenache and Cinsault bloom together in this generous wine. Its warm fruitiness is balanced with a mineral edge, a touch of tannin and plenty of spice and herbal flavors. That all says the wine could age a few months, so drink from late 2018.

title: Erste Neue 2017 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: Quintessential varietal aromas of tomato leaf, green pepper and tropical fruit take center stage in this wine. On the palate, tangy acidity balances creamy white peach and juicy grapefruit notes while dill and thyme accents provide backup.

title: Esterházy 2017 Chardonnay (Burgenland)
description: The nose is a mix of Golden Delicious apple and bright lemon. The palate picks up these notions and adds textural zesty pleasure while remaining resolutely dry, joyful and bright. This is an unusual but vivid Chardonnay with a lovely echo of pure lemon freshness.

title: Familia Cassone 2013 Obra Prima Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Earthy, leafy plum aromas come with leather and graphite notes. Proper balance and a good structure give this Malbec the right kind of mouthfeel. Earthy berry flavors are a bit roasted and oaky, with coffee and chocolate accents that carry over to a finish with heat.

title: Fattoria di Grignano 2013 Poggio Gualtieri Riserva  (Chianti Rufina)
description: This blend of 80% Sangiovese and 20% Merlot offers inviting aromas of mature black-skinned berries, new leather and cedar. The concentrated palate doles out black plum, clove and tobacco flavors alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.

title: Gunter Triebaumer 2016 Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: Luscious notes of ripe dark plum and black cherry on the nose lead to an equally fruit-driven, almost sumptuous palate. This is soft, juicy, smooth and full of ripe dark fruit. There is a frame of ripe but grippy tannin and enough freshness to counter this plushness.

title: Gunter Triebaumer 2017 Furmint (Burgenland)
description: The first whiff of earthy ethereal herb signals something unusual. Fresh clear apple notes mingle with wet earth and lemon. The bright light but very fluid body has an arresting sense of fresh blood and an abundance of apple flavors. This is dry, light but visceral with a long echo.

title: H.& C. Nittnaus 2017 Heideboden Chardonnay (Burgenland)
description: A subtle floral note of sun-ripened yellow plum makes for a charming if unusual nose for the variety. The palate has the customary texture of Chardonnay but the fruit expression is one of ripeness, ease and freshness. The finish is completely dry and beautifully textured.

title: Hawley 2015 Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Bright layered acidity provides a fresh take on this varietal wine. A fleshy juicy core builds power and full-bodied richness on the midpalate. Red cherry and cassis are highlights, alongside a pretty aroma of violet and lavender.

title: Hosmer 2016 Pinot Noir (Cayuga Lake)
description: A mossy, earthy nose carries to a palate of tart red cherry and pink peppercorn. Medium in weight, there's a soft grip to the tannins that offer plenty of texture and support. This is a tight and dry Pinot Noir that will blossom with a few years in the bottle. Drink from 2020.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2014 Cabernet Franc (Howell Mountain)
description: A fully 100% varietal wine, this offers a wealth of earthy truffle, chocolate, rich blueberry and intense layers of flavors structured in chalky tannin. A dusting of dried herb and spicy pepper lie in wait.

title: Jaffurs 2016 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Always one of the better priced red wines to come out of Santa Barbara each year, this vintage shows freshly pressed boysenberry, lilac, flowering rosemary and white pepper on the nose. Lively, energetic flavors of grape Jolly Rancher meet with pepper and herbs on the fresh palate.

title: JaM 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: True to its name, this bold and full-bodied wine does have a jammy character like well-ripened blackberries, but it stops short of sweetness. It shows a lot of fruit concentration, mild oak spices and a good velvety layer of tannin to make it lip-smacking.

title: Keller 2015 Oro De Plata Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a tart briny wine from the newly minted Petaluma Gap that hints at green olive (the kind found in a Martini glass). Subdued, it offers floral honeysuckle and apple-blossom aromas that pair well with notions of green apple.

title: Konrad 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine, sourced from organically grown grapes and made by German ex-pats, shows plenty of waxy lemon, pineapple rind and green bean characters, with white pepper and mint aromas adding complexity. The palate is downright opulent—textural weight is balanced by tingly acidity with a salty finish.

title: La Honda Winery 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Tangy lime, lemongrass and green grass met with chalky minerality on the nose of this bottling. It's crisp and taut on the palate, but allows slightly riper Gravenstein apple flavors and approachable grassy tones to round out the midpalate.

title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2017 Château Clémentine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: A well-balanced wine, this is poised comfortably between ripe fruits and the crispest acidity. Raspberry flavors are lifted by citrus and freshened by kiwi fruit. It's tangy, zesty and ready to drink.
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

title: Lightwell Survey 2015 Hintermen White (Shenandoah Valley)
description: A blend of Riesling and Petit Manseng, this wine is anything but ordinary. A gorgeous bouquet of orange peel, geranium, white peach and petrol lead the way to flavors that echo the aromas, as well as additional notes of apple peel, button mushroom and oyster. The umami element is really engaging to the senses and adds a creamy dimension the the mouthfeel. Despite the lovely acidity, the finish is won over by a creaminess.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Lopez Ranch Old Vine De Ambrogio Block Private Reserve Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)
description: The nose of this bottling from an old vineyard in Rancho Cucamonga carries aromas of blackberry jelly on wet slate, with a touch of violets. The palate is rich and flavorful, with more blackberry paste, a dusting of cracked pepper and a warm toast tone, framed by decent acidity.
designation: Lopez Ranch Old Vine De Ambrogio Block Private Reserve

title: Lovingston 2016 Gilbert's Vineyard Pinotage (Monticello)
description: Lush aromas of smoke, black cherry, clove, cinnamon and game lead the way to the palate. Full in body, with silky tannins and vibrant acidity, this wine offers a lingering smoky finish.

title: Maison Saint Aix 2017 Aix Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: This wine has the richness characteristic of Aix-en-Provence. Ripe red fruits, layers of intense acidity and tangy texture come together to make a wine that is packed with fruitiness as well as great freshness. Drink this full-bodied wine from late 2018.

title: Mannucci Droandi 2008 Ceppeto  (Vin Santo del Chianti Classico)
description: Made from organically farmed, dried Trebbiano, Malvasia and San Colombano grapes, this offers walnut, candied nectarine and caramel aromas. The rich but balanced palate delivers mature apricot, toasted almond and fig flavors.

title: Mark Ryan 2016 Olsen Vineyard Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)
description: This is Mark Ryan's first offering of this wine, coming from vines planted for the winery in 2013. A blend of three different clones, aromas of lees, peach, lemon curd and spice lead to creamy well-balanced flavors that lead to an impressively long finish. It's equal parts promise and delivery.

title: Martin Ranch 2015 Therese Vineyards Reserve Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)
description: A swirl of smoke, blackberry paste, lavender, rosemary and sagebrush kick off the nose to this reserve bottling. Dried earth, wild red berries and red flowers show on the palate, which is reminiscent of the wines of old California.
